text: Craig Hoyer (born 6 September 1960) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Hawthorn in the Victorian Football League (VFL). Hoyer was a ruckman, originally from Redcliffe, who had played three seasons with Swan Districts before joining Hawthorn. The Western Australian played just two senior games for Hawthorn, one each in the 1981 and 1982 seasons.AFL Tables: Craig Hoyer He returned home in 1984 to play again at Swan Districts but after a year he was on the move again, signing with the Hobart Football Club. In both 1986 and 1987, Hoyer won Hobart's "Best and Fairest" award. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:Australian rules footballers from Western Australia Category:Hawthorn Football Club players Category:Swan Districts Football Club players Category:Hobart Football Club players Category:Living people
